heading: ebay earnings jump tenfold
subheading: the auction site says a big jump in revenue and registered users boosted profit. but the results just meet wall street expectations.
author: wired news report
text: ebay said on tuesday its fourth-quarter net income jumped almost tenfold, about as much as wall street had expected, on strong holiday sales. the online auctioneer earned us$1.5 million, or 4 cents per share, for the three months ended 31 december, compared with $189,000, or a penny a share, a year ago.wall street expected the san jose, california, company to earn 4 cents a share, according to zacks investment research.fourth-quarter revenue rose 642 percent to $19.5 million from $2.6 million reported for the same period last year.the number of registered users tapping into ebay's auctions also increased by about 916,000 to 2.1 million in the fourth quarter. ebay said it also hosted more auctions, a total of about 13.6 million, up from 9.2 million in the previous quarter.ebay (ebay) released its earnings shortly after markets closed on tuesday. its shares closed at $220.88, up $3.38.
